DataElement.preferredName: Prior Systemic Therapy Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to the prior administration of systemic therapy as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Systemic Therapy Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:(sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.

Concepts.definition: Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received at least one line of prior systemic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received 1-3 prio
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received 1-3 prior systemic therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior systemic therapy in the recurrent or metastatic setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has not had prior systemic therapy in the recurrent or metastatic setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received at least one line of systemic therapy in the advanced/metastatic setting or disease has no known effective options or patient has declined standard of care therapy prior to study introduction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients with mismatch repair proficient/microsatellite stable colorectal cancer in the phase 2 portion, has patient received prior therapy with 1 or more systemic therapies in the metastatic setting that includes 5-fluorouracil, irinotecan, and oxaliplatin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any prior systemic therapy to treat the patient’s kidney cancer within 4 weeks or, if known, 5 half-lives of the prior agent (whichever is shorter) prior to Cycle 1 Day 1?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.5.3 Updated AQT per ticket CADSR0002390. ak
